intro: Pulmonaria angustifolia var. maculata, commonly known as spotted lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves with distinctive red and purple spots, giving it a striking appearance. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its foliage and floral display make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental ground cover.
